name: National Association of Muslim Lawyers
mission: Improving and Enhancing the Legal Profession
zakatClaimEvidence: The search results for the National Association of Muslim Lawyers (NAML) do not explicitly mention that the organization accepts zakat donations. NAML is identified as a 501(c)(6) organization, which is a business league, not a public charity. While NAML has a sister charitable organization, Muslim Advocates (a 501(c)(3)), and partners with the National Muslim Law Students Association (NMLSA) which has a donation page, there is no direct evidence on NAML's own activities or donation pages indicating zakat acceptance. (Source: https://naml.net/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Limited match due to weaker results and/or higher uncertainty; review methodology details before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 24/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, advocacy cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build reserves toward your board-approved target range (often 3-12 months), adjusted for revenue volatility and obligations.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes over at least 3 years.
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

components.evidence: Theory of change: BASIC (emerging org baseline)
components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

components.evidence: Board governance: baseline (unknown members, emerging org)
components.name: Governance

score_details.score_summary: National Association of Muslim Lawyers shows moderate alignment and limited impact. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: The search results for the National Association of Muslim Lawyers (NAML) do not explicitly mention that the organization accepts zakat donations. NAML is identified as a 501(c)(6) organization, which is a business league, not a public charity. While NAML has a sister charitable organization, Muslim Advocates (a 501(c)(3)), and partners with the National Muslim Law Students Association (NMLSA) which has a donation page, there is no direct evidence on NAML's own activities or donation pages indicating zakat acceptance. (Source: https://naml.net/donate)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported total revenue of $85,362 and focuses on professional networking and legal resources.
The organization accepts general charitable donations through its website.
The organization maintains working capital of 2.6 months.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization receives a lower overall score due to limited data confidence and a modest financial scale. While it serves a specific niche, the lack of third-party verification and detailed impact metrics affects its rating.
areas_for_improvement: Limited financial transparency and public data availability
Low working capital reserves of 2.6 months

dimension_explanations.alignment: Alignment is rated as medium, reflecting a balanced view of its role in advocacy for the legal community [1]. However, the donor fit is considered low for general Muslim donors as the organization focuses on a specific professional niche rather than broad humanitarian or urgent social needs [2].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization's impact score is low because there is limited evidence regarding the direct effectiveness of its capacity-building programs [1]. Financial health is constrained by a working capital of only 2.6 months, and there is a lack of third-party verification for its program outcomes [3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The National Association of Muslim Lawyers serves as a professional hub dedicated to enhancing the legal profession through networking and community resources.
strengths: Maintains a specialized focus on professional networking and legal community resources
Provides a platform for legal professionals to connect and share expertise
baseline_narrative.summary: The National Association of Muslim Lawyers (NAML) operates as a professional organization focused on improving the legal field through networking and resource sharing [1]. Based on recent financial filings, the organization reported a total revenue of $85,362 [1][3]. Individuals interested in supporting their mission can contribute via general sadaqah donations through their online platform [2].
